guide.introduction: Have you ever wanted to share files between two computers without a flashdrive or play a game together with your friend? This guide shows you how to set up a P2P or Point-To-Point network. A P2P network is basically a network between two computers; sometimes it's referred as an ad-hoc network. This project has a lot of steps but those are there in case you have some trouble. Only the first two steps are key; the rest is for troubleshooting. Enough talking, let's get to it!
guide.introduction_rendered:
Have you ever wanted to share files between two computers without a flashdrive or play a game together with your friend? This guide shows you how to set up a P2P or Point-To-Point network. A P2P network is basically a network between two computers; sometimes it's referred as an ad-hoc network. This project has a lot of steps but those are there in case you have some trouble. Only the first two steps are key; the rest is for troubleshooting. Enough talking, let's get to it!

Relevant parts
  • Computer with an Ethernet port
  • Crossover LAN Cable

parts.notes: You can get these from your local electronics store!

steps.title: Plug the cable into the computers

lines.text: Just plug the crossover network cable into the network port in both computers!
lines.text_raw: Just plug the crossover network cable into the network port in both computers!

lines.text: Now, normally the computers should connect by default, but if for some reason the computers won't connect to each other, I've listed some troubleshooting tips in the next steps!
lines.text_raw: Now, normally the computers should connect by default, but if for some reason the computers won't connect to each other, I've listed some troubleshooting tips in the next steps!

lines.text: In order for computers to connect to each other, they have to be in the same workgroup! In the next few steps I'll show you how to change the computers' workgroup settings!
lines.text_raw: In order for computers to connect to each other, they have to be in the same workgroup! In the next few steps I'll show you how to change the computers' workgroup settings!

lines.text: (Note: the OS used here is Microsoft XP, but it should be the same for all Microsoft operating systems!
lines.text_raw: (Note: the OS used here is Microsoft XP, but it should be the same for all Microsoft operating systems!

lines.text: Picture 1: Click Start - Right-click on "My Computer" and select "Properties"!
lines.text_raw: Picture 1: Click Start - Right-click on "My Computer" and select "Properties"!

lines.text: Picture 2: Click on the "Computer Name" tab!
lines.text_raw: Picture 2: Click on the "Computer Name" tab!

lines.text: Picture 3: Click on the button next to where it says "change computer name" (in my case the button was named "Change") to change your workgroup name!
lines.text_raw: Picture 3: Click on the button next to where it says "change computer name" (in my case the button was named "Change") to change your workgroup name!

lines.text: Proceed to next step!
lines.text_raw: Proceed to next step!

lines.text: Picture 1: You should see a window like this appear!
lines.text_raw: Picture 1: You should see a window like this appear!

lines.text: Picture 2: Now change the workgroup name to your preference!
lines.text_raw: Picture 2: Now change the workgroup name to your preference!

lines.text: Now repeat on the other computer! (Make sure that the workgroup name is the SAME on both computers!)
lines.text_raw: Now repeat on the other computer! (Make sure that the workgroup name is the SAME on both computers!)

lines.text: If not, proceed to the next step!
lines.text_raw: If not, proceed to the next step!

lines.text: Note: These settings may vary depending on your operating system!
lines.text_raw: Note: These settings may vary depending on your operating system!

lines.text: Picture 1: Go to your configurations panel and then to your network adaptors! Right-click on the adaptor that says "LAN Connection" (or something similar!)
lines.text_raw: Picture 1: Go to your configurations panel and then to your network adaptors! Right-click on the adaptor that says "LAN Connection" (or something similar!)

lines.text: Picture 2: Click on "Internet Protocol" (TCP/IP or IPv4). Next, click properties!
lines.text_raw: Picture 2: Click on "Internet Protocol" (TCP/IP or IPv4). Next, click properties!

lines.text: Picture 3: A window like the one in the image should pop up and the values will probably look like these in the photo!
lines.text_raw: Picture 3: A window like the one in the image should pop up and the values will probably look like these in the photo!

lines.text: Please note that the values displayed here are completely made up!
lines.text_raw: Please note that the values displayed here are completely made up!

lines.text: Proceed to next step!
lines.text_raw: Proceed to next step!

lines.text: Picture 1 & 2: Click on "Auto Obtain IP Address and DNS Server"!
lines.text_raw: Picture 1 & 2: Click on "Auto Obtain IP Address and DNS Server"!

lines.text: Done!
lines.text_raw: Done!

lines.text: If it still won't connect...* well, check the Internet; there are a lot of helpful forums to help you out! (*Beyond my logic... lol)
lines.text_raw: If it still won't connect...* well, check the Internet; there are a lot of helpful forums to help you out! (*Beyond my logic... lol)

guide.summary: This guide teaches you how to create a Point-To-Point network between two computers.
